title: How to Make Chocolate Chunk Banana Bread

steps.headline: Combine the softened butter, sugar and eggs and blend with mixer.
steps.description: Add in vanilla and half of banana mash and mix again.

steps.headline: After blended, add in the other half of banana mash and blend again with mixer.
In a separate bowl, combine flour, baking soda and cocoa powder.
steps.description: Add this flour mixture to the batter in 3 or 4 stages blending with the mixer after each addition.

steps.headline: Once completely blended, fold in the sour cream and chocolate chips until well mixed.
Pour the batter into a lightly greased 9×5 inch (12.7 cm) loaf pan and bake in a preheated 350 °F (177 °C) oven for 60 minutes.
steps.description:

steps.headline: Continue baking if not ready.
steps.description:
Remove from oven and cool in the pan slightly before removing from pan. Continue cooling on rack, then slice when completely cooled. Makes approximately 16 slices. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/4\/42\/Make-Chocolate-Chunk-Banana-Bread-Step-6Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Make-Chocolate-Chunk-Banana-Bread-Step-6Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/4\/42\/Make-Chocolate-Chunk-Banana-Bread-Step-6Bullet1.jpg\/aid673851-v4-728px-Make-Chocolate-Chunk-Banana-Bread-Step-6Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"485","licensing":"

text:
Combine the softened butter, sugar and eggs and blend with mixer. Add in vanilla and half of banana mash and mix again. After blended, add in the other half of banana mash and blend again with mixer. In a separate bowl, combine flour, baking soda and cocoa powder. Add this flour mixture to the batter in 3 or 4 stages blending with the mixer after each addition. Once completely blended, fold in the sour cream and chocolate chips until well mixed. Pour the batter into a lightly greased 9×5 inch (12.7 cm) loaf pan and bake in a preheated 350 °F (177 °C) oven for 60 minutes. After 60 minutes, check with a toothpick inserted into the center of the loaf to see if it comes out clean. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/e\/ea\/Make-Chocolate-Chunk-Banana-Bread-Step-5Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Make-Chocolate-Chunk-Banana-Bread-Step-5Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/e\/ea\/Make-Chocolate-Chunk-Banana-Bread-Step-5Bullet1.jpg\/aid673851-v4-728px-Make-Chocolate-Chunk-Banana-Bread-Step-5Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"485","licensing":"

License: Fair Use<\/a> (screenshot)
\n<\/p><\/div>"} Continue baking if not ready. Remove from oven and cool in the pan slightly before removing from pan. Continue cooling on rack, then slice when completely cooled. Makes approximately 16 slices. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/4\/42\/Make-Chocolate-Chunk-Banana-Bread-Step-6Bullet1.jpg\/v4-459px-Make-Chocolate-Chunk-Banana-Bread-Step-6Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"\/images\/thumb\/4\/42\/Make-Chocolate-Chunk-Banana-Bread-Step-6Bullet1.jpg\/aid673851-v4-728px-Make-Chocolate-Chunk-Banana-Bread-Step-6Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":306,"bigWidth":"728","bigHeight":"485","licensing":"
